decision_conditions: The tree is healthy and well shaped and makes a valuable contribution to the character and visual amenity of the area.  The proposals are considered excessive, unnecessary and harmful and are contrary to the aims of policies CS3, CS8, DM6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012. Additionaly it is apparent that the tree is not in the applicant's property and the owners of the tree have expressed that they are unwilling for the works to take place.

Heritage Statement - The site address is within the Tudor Estate Local Area of Special Character, therefore please provide a Heritage Statement in line with the Householder Validation Local List requirement (see pages 33-35).

The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed by relevant consultees and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details, in relation to Condition 23 (external lighting) of planning permission 22/01273/KPSID which states:Prior to its installation, details of any external lighting associated with the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be implemented and maintained in accordance with those details as may be approved.Reason: In the interests of the appearance of the development and the amenity of neighbouring properties.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T.1 Oak - 2.5m Holistic crown reduction, rebalancing & removal of deadwood.
